page.title: 03 VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Iver Heath New Village Hall was built in 1966 for the community.It consists of a big hall and stage,two smaller rooms,kitchen and toilets,plus a telephone.The hall is used for local organisations and clubs,seating 200 people.Guides and Brownies hire the hall for meetings and jumble sales.Keep fit,badminton,yoga,country dancing and ballet classes use it once or more a week.There is an old peoples club called FORGET ME NOT,a gardening club and a play group.People hire it for 21st birthdays,weddings,childrens parties and discos.The drama club perform plays using the lighting and audio equipment.The Womans Institute and baby clinic use it.During elections it is a polling station.If one lives in Iver Heath,the hire fee is reduced. By Alison Woolley
